TopicTitle: I found a new Kraken, I call it the Disco Kraken.

Articles.Content:
Yeah it started like the first image, Just kept playing until.... It started flashing quickly and then this happened.

Javascript is disabled. View full album
Yeah, your graphics card is playing up, might be heat, or loose or old drivers or a bad setting, we'll need your logs, dxdiag, driver number and stuff

Running mac so, I don't think I have DxDiag, As for logs, It fired none It seems that the game didn't register it was doing anything abnormal, Zooming out Turned it back into something like the First Picture but spazzy. I find that this issue is caused by an overload of textures trying to render.

I noticed something weird is going on in the top right

Using:

-Fine Print

-Kethane ( Seems to be incompatible with Unity?, May change to Karbonite and see what happens)

-Alarm Clock

-000Toolbar

-StationPartsExpansion[Removed it was causing issues]

-ScanSat

-Engineer

-RasterPropMoniter(I don't remember getting this one must be a dependency)

-NearFutureProps(Another Dependency)

It's too long to Spoiler

http://mypastebin.com/pK0fg7NWIwza

Edited October 18, 2014 by vat21s
Got some form of log

You're right about not having a DxDiag, but more information would help. The How to Get Support (READ FIRST) sticky will tell you where to find your Player.log. This log is always generated from the moment the program starts until it ends. If you haven't played since the graphical glitches occurred, I'd love to take a look through that log. We'll need a complete copy, so I recommend a filehosting site like Dropbox or Google Drive.

While I can't help very much other than agreeing with those above me, I will say: be glad you aren't epileptic.

If you are epileptic, be glad you're okay.

There will be the player.log, if the game is doing anything weird it should say in there, please see the support stickies for more info.

The pics make it look like your GFX card is dying :/
